page.title: 08LOCAL HISTORY.
page.content: Ilfracombe was once called Alferthingcomb(Alfred).Ilfracombe is an ancient sea port and market town.The port of Ilfracombe was very important in the 18th century,and to show this the following figures are quoted:29 ships cleared,1,167 tonnage cleared,and 40 average tonnage per ship.Most of the ships went to and from Cork and a few to Barbados in the West Indies.The railway was built to Ilfracombe in 1874 and helped tourism in Ilfracombe.It was closed in 1970. About 165 years ago Ilfracombe consisted chiefly of one long street, but about twenty years later accommodation was built for the many visitors.Rows of tall houses and villas were built on the terraces.Two major fires happened in the same place one in 1896 and the other in 1983.Also shipwrecks have occured off the coast.
